examples: But he had a quick temper and that put me off.

The manager was known for his calm demeanor, but when his employee made the same mistake for the third time, he finally lost his temper and reprimanded them - every dog gets one bite.
words.defineEn: make more temperate, acceptable, or suitable by adding something else

examples: Further north, in temperate and high latitudes, the net primary production varies seasonally.

words.defineEn: not extreme in behavior

examples: My sister rearranged the furniture in her room to create more space.

examples: After the scandal, the politician worked hard to rebuild his reputation and live down the controversy.

examples: Their clever tunneling work notwithstanding, they were all easily recaptured in the city.

examples: The doctor advised wearing protective clothing to minimize exposure to harmful radiation during the X-ray procedure.
